algorithm_technique: Merge sorted arrays in-place using three pointers, starting from the end of both arrays.
problem_summary_simple: Merge two sorted arrays into the first array, which has enough space.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize three pointers (one for nums1's end, one for nums2's end, one for the merged array's end) to place elements correctly in nums1.
key_insights: Merging from the end of the arrays is crucial for in-place modification without overwriting needed elements.
A third pointer tracks the position where the next largest element should be placed in nums1.
After merging the common elements, any remaining elements in nums2 are simply copied over.
